glsa.title: OpenSLP: Multiple buffer overflows
glsa.synopsis: Multiple buffer overflows have been found in OpenSLP, which could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: OpenSLP is an open-source implementation of Service Location Protocol (SLP).

description.p: Multiple buffer overflows have been found in OpenSLP, when handling malformed SLP packets.

impact.p: By sending specially crafted SLP packets, a remote attacker could potentially execute arbitrary code with the rights of the OpenSLP daemon.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All OpenSLP users should upgrade to the latest version:
